ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package openssh-server Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package openssh-server should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service sshd Disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The sshd service should be disabled if possible.

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Package openssh-server removed or service sshd not configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Service sshd Enabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The sshd service should be enabled if possible.

ns0:criteria.comment: package openssh-server installed and service sshd is configured to start
service sshd is configured to start

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set All Accounts To Have Unique Names
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All accounts on the system should have unique names for proper accountability.

ns0:criteria.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The maximum password age policy should meet minimum requirements.

ns0:criteria.comment: The value PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The minimum password age policy should be set appropriately.

ns0:criteria.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: UID 0 Belongs Only To Root
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Only the root account should be assigned a user id of 0.

ns0:criterion.comment: tests that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: All Password Hashes Shadowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: All password hashes should be shadowed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password minimum length should be set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set Password Expiration Parameters
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The password expiration warning age should be set appropriately.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Lock out account after failed login attempts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The number of allowed failed logins should be set correctly.

ns0:criterion.comment: pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in system-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of system-auth
pam_faillock.so preauth silent set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so authfail deny value set in password-auth
pam_faillock.so set in account phase of password-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Write permissions are disabled for group and other in all directories in Root's Path
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check each directory in root's path and make use it does not grant write permission to group and other

ns0:criteria.comment: Check that write permission to group and other in root's path is denied

ns0:criterion.comment: Check for write permission to group and other in root's path

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: The syslog Plugin Of the Audit Event Multiplexor (audispd) Is Activated
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: active setting in /etc/audisp/plugins.d/syslog.conf is set to 'yes'

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: 'log_group' Not Set To 'root' In /etc/audit/auditd.conf
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Verify 'log_group' is not set to 'root' in /etc/audit/auditd.conf.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Email Account to Notify Upon Action
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: action_mail_acct setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain account

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk is Low on Space
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: admin_space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Maximum Log File Size
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: max_log_file setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Maximum Log Size Reached
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: max_log_file_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Maximum Number of Logs to Retain
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: num_logs setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to at least a certain value

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Auditd Action to Take When Disk Starting to Run Low on Space
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: space_left_action setting in /etc/audit/auditd.conf is set to a certain action

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure Yum gpgcheck Globally Activated
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The gpgcheck option should be used to ensure that checking of an RPM package's signature always occurs prior to its installation.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify /var/log/audit Ownership
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Checks that all /var/log/audit files and directories are owned by the root user and group.

ns0:criteria.comment: directories are root owned
log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:extend_definition.comment: log_group in auditd.conf is not root

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Proper Permissions User Home Directories
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: File permissions should be set correctly for the home directories for all user accounts.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Find Unauthorized World-Writable Files
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The world-write permission should be disabled for all files.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package Antivirus Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Antivirus software should be installed.

ns0:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package McAfeeVSEForLinux Installed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: McAfee Antivirus software should be installed.

ns0:criteria.comment: Antivirus is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries and Linux Agent
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the McAfee Runtime Libraries (MFErt) and Linux Agent (MFEcma).

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install McAfee Host-Based Intrusion Detection Software (HBSS)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: McAfee Host-Based Intrusion Detection Software (HBSS) software should be installed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the Asset Configuration Compliance Module (ACCM).

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the McAfee Host Intrusion Prevention System (HIPS) Module if it is absolutely necessary. If SELinux is enabled, do not install or enable this module.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Install the Policy Auditor (PA) Module.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: CentOS 6
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is CentOS 6

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: CentOS 7
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is CentOS 7

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Installed operating system is Fedora
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Fedora

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:criterion.comment: CPE vendor is 'fedoraproject' and product is 'fedora'

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: OpenSUSE
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is OpenSUSE.

ns0:criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Installed operating system is part of the Unix family
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is part of the Unix OS family

ns0:criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7

ns0:criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family

ns0:criteria.comment: Red Hat Enterpise Virtualization Host is installed

ns0:criterion.comment: Red Hat Enterpise Virtualization Host is based on RHEL 7

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Scientific Linux 6
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Scientific Linux 6

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Scientific Linux 7
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Scientific Linux 7

ns0:extend_definition.comment: Installed OS is part of the Unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: WRLinux
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The operating system installed on the system is Wind River Linux

ns0:criterion.comment: Installed operating system is part of the unix family

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check if the scan target is a container
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it does then we consider to be a docker filesystem.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Check if the scan target is a machine
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Check if file /.dockerenv exists, if it doesn't then we consider to be host filesystem or virtual machine.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Direct root Logins Not Allowed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root logins help ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: No nullok Option in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The file /etc/pam.d/system-auth should not contain the nullok option

ns0:criterion.comment: make sure the nullok option is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Ensure insecure_locks is disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Allowing insecure file locking could allow for sensitive data to be viewed or edited by an unauthorized user.

ns0:criterion.comment: Check for insecure NFS locks in /etc/exports

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Verify No netrc Files Exist
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The .netrc files contain login information used to auto-login into FTP servers and reside in the user's home directory. Any .netrc files should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: System Accounts Do Not Run a Shell
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The root account is the only system account that should have a login shell.

ns0:criterion.comment: Test shell defined for UID from <0, UID_MIN -1>
Test shell defined for reserved system UIDs
Test shell defined for dynamically allocated system UIDs

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package net-snmp Removed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package net-snmp should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Package prelink Removed
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The RPM package prelink should be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Serial Port Root Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root login to serial port interfaces helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Restrict Virtual Console Root Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Preventing direct root login to virtual console devices helps ensure accountability for actions taken on the system using the root account.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SNMP default communities disabled
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SNMP default communities must be removed.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: SNMP use newer protocols
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SNMP version 1 and 2c must not be enabled.

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable Empty Passwords
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Remote connections from accounts with empty passwords should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable SSH Support for Rhosts RSA Authentication
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSH can allow authentication through the obsolete rsh command through the use of the authenticating user's SSH keys. This should be disabled.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable root Login via SSH
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Root login via SSH should be disabled (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Disable SSH Support for User Known Hosts
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: SSH can allow system users host-based authentication to connect to systems if a cache of the remote systems public keys are available. This should be disabled.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Enable X11 Forwarding
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Enable X11Forwarding to encrypt X11 remote connections over SSH.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set OpenSSH Idle Timeout Interval
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SSH idle timeout interval should be set to an appropriate value.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set ClientAliveCountMax for User Logins
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SSH ClientAliveCountMax should be set to an appropriate value (and dependencies are met)

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set OpenSSH LogLevel to INFO
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SSH LogLevel should be set to INFO.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Set OpenSSH authentication attempt limit (MaxAuthTries)
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: The SSH MaxAuthTries should be set to an appropriate value.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Use Only Strong Ciphers
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Only use strong ciphers.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Use Only Strong MACs
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Only use strong MACs.

ns0:criteria.comment: SSH is not being used or conditions are met

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Test for 64-bit Architecture
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Generic test for 64-bit architectures to be used by other tests

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Test for PPC and PPCLE Architecture
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Generic test for PPC PPC64LE architecture to be used by other tests

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Test for x86 Architecture
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Generic test for x86 architecture to be used by other tests

ns0:metadata.ns0:title: Test for x86_64 Architecture
ns0:metadata.ns0:description: Generic test for x86_64 architecture to be used by other tests

ns4:variable_test.comment: There should not exist duplicate user name entries in /etc/passwd
The value of PASS_MAX_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_MIN_DAYS should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns4:textfilecontent54_test.comment: test that there are no accounts with UID 0 except root in the /etc/passwd file

ns4:variable_test.comment: The value of PASS_MIN_LEN should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs
The value of PASS_WARN_AGE should be set appropriately in /etc/login.defs

ns4:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/system-auth (authfail)
Check if pam_faillock_so is called in account phase of /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Check pam_faillock.so preauth silent present in /etc/pam.d/password-auth
Check maximum failed login attempts allowed in /etc/pam.d/password-auth (authfail)
Check if pam_faillock_so is called in account phase of /etc/pam.d/password-auth

ns5:file_test.comment: Check if there aren't directories in root's path having write permission set for group or other

ns4:textfilecontent54_test.comment: CPE vendor is 'fedoraproject' and 'product' is fedora

ns4:family_test.comment: installed OS part of unix family
Test installed OS is part of the unix family
installed OS part of unix family
installed OS part of unix family

ns4:textfilecontent54_test.comment: make sure nullok is not used in /etc/pam.d/system-auth
Tests the value of the insecure locks in /etc/exports

ns4:variable_test.comment: <0, UID_MIN - 1> system UIDs having shell set
<0, SYS_UID_MIN> system UIDs having shell set
<SYS_UID_MIN, SYS_UID_MAX> system UIDS having shell set

ns4:textfilecontent54_test.comment: Tests the value of the PermitEmptyPasswords[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the RhostsRSAAuthentication[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the PermitRootLogin[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the IgnoreUserKnownHosts[\s]*(<:nocomment:>*) setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of X11Forwarding setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
Tests the value of the ClientAliveCountMax setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of Ciphers setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file
tests the value of MACs setting in the /etc/ssh/sshd_config file

ns5:file_object.comment: root's path directories with wrong group / other write permissions

ns3:systemdunitdependency_state.comment: sshd listed at least once in the dependencies

ns5:file_state.comment: group or other has write privilege

ns4:textfilecontent54_state.comment: upper bound of ClientAliveInterval in seconds
lower bound of ClientAliveInterval in seconds

ns0:local_variable.comment: Count of all username rows retrieved from /etc/passwd (including duplicates if any)
Count of unique username rows retrieved from /etc/passwd
The value of last PASS_MAX_DAYS directive in /etc/login.defs
The value of last PASS_MIN_DAYS directive in /etc/login.defs
The value of last PASS_MIN_LEN directive in /etc/login.defs
The value of last PASS_WARN_AGE directive in /etc/login.defs

ns0:external_variable.comment: password expiration warning age in days
number of failed login attempts allowed

ns0:local_variable.comment: Split the PATH on the : delimiter
